snippet: Ali Abdullah Saleh, Yemen’s former president, is a rarity in the Arab world: an autocrat overthrown by popular revolt who nonetheless remains in his country, undisturbed.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Yemen's former president Ali Abdullah Saleh, who occupies rare position in the Arab world of being an autocrat overthrown by popular revolt who nonetheless remains in his country, unmolested.
lead_paragraph: Ali Abdullah Saleh, Yemen’s former president, is a rarity in the Arab world: an autocrat overthrown by popular revolt who nonetheless remains in his country, undisturbed.

headline.main: Even Out of Office, a Wielder of Great Power in Yemen
headline.print_headline: Even Out of Office, a Wielder of Great Power in Yemen

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
